text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Tomei was born in Gifu on June 1, 1972. She played for Iga FC Kunoichi (formerly Prima Ham FC Kunoichi) from 1988 to 2000. The club won Nadeshiko League championship in 1995 and 1999. She was also selected Best Eleven 5 times (1994, 1995, 1996, 1997 and 1999). In December 1993, Tomei was selected the Japan national team for 1993 AFC Championship. At this competition, on December 6, she debuted against Philippines. She also played at 1994, 1998 Asian Games, 1995 and 1997 AFC Championship. She was a member of Japan for 1995, 1999 World Cup and 1996 Summer Olympics. She played 43 games and scored 6 goals for Japan until 1999. ==Statistics== Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 1993 2 2 1994 6 0 1995 8 3 1996 9 0 1997 6 1 1998 6 0 1999 6 0 Total 43 6 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Gifu Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Iga FC Kunoichi Mie players Category:Footballers at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:1995 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:1999 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:1993 AFC Women's Championship players Category:1995 AFC Women's Championship players Category:1997 AFC Women's Championship players Category:Footballers at the 1994 Asian Games Category:Footballers at the 1998 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in football Category:Asian Games silver medalists for Japan Category:Asian Games bronze medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 1994 Asian Games Category:Medalists at the 1998 Asian Games
title: Yumi Tomei
